source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
topic: 3.3.6.3 Connection with the Sakha Purposive Converb
notes: In his discussion of the Sakha Future Imperative, Böhtlingk (Btl: 303) also proposes that it represents an old participle, the accusative form of which (–A:rI) nowadays has supinal meaning.
sah: Тугу да аһаабат буола ыксаан бартым көрдөрөөрү.
en: Not having been able to eat anything (I) hurried in order to show myself (to him). [what.ACC PTL eat–PRSPT.NEG AUX–IPF.CVB hurry–PF.CVB go–PSTPT–POSS.1SG look–CAUS–PURP]
